# IOWarp Plugins for Claude Code Plugin marketplace for IOWarp project tools and integrations. Provides Claude Code plugins for scientific data platforms, HPC workflows, and research automation. ## üöÄ Quick Start > **Note:** Open Claude Code before running these commands. ### Step 1: Add IOWarp Marketplace Choose one of the following methods: #### From GitHub (Recommended) ```bash /plugin marketplace add SIslamMun/iowarp-plugin ``` #### From Local Directory ```bash git clone https://github.com/SIslamMun/iowarp-plugin.git /plugin marketplace add /path/to/iowarp-plugin ``` #### Via Marketplace URL ```bash /plugin marketplace add https://github.com/SIslamMun/iowarp-plugin.git ``` ### Step 2: Install Plugins ```bash # Install NDP plugin /plugin install ndp-plugin@iowarp-plugins # View all available plugins /plugin ``` ## üì¶ Available Plugins | Plugin | Description | Features | |--------|-------------|----------| | **üîç NDP Plugin** | Dataset search, discovery, and workflow automation for the **National Data Platform** (CKAN-based instances) | **Commands:** 3 slash commands
‚Ä¢ `/ndp-search` - Search datasets
‚Ä¢ `/ndp-organizations` - List organizations
‚Ä¢ `/ndp-dataset-details` - Get dataset info

**Agents:** 2 specialized agents
‚Ä¢ Data Scientist - Research & analysis
‚Ä¢ Dataset Curator - Management & quality

**MCP Tools:** 3 automation tools
‚Ä¢ `list_organizations`
‚Ä¢ `search_datasets`
‚Ä¢ `get_dataset_details`

**Hooks:** ‚úÖ Event logging enabled | > üìñ **Documentation:** [NDP Plugin README](./ndp-plugin/README.md) ‚Ä¢ [Testing Guide](./ndp-plugin/TESTING.md) ‚Ä¢ [Demo Guide](./ndp-plugin/DEMO_GUIDE.md) ### üîÆ Coming Soon More IOWarp project integrations will be added to this marketplace. ## üìã Requirements - Claude Code installed - Python 3.10 or higher - `uv` package manager (for MCP server) ## üîç Verify Installation ```bash # Check if plugin is enabled /plugin # View available commands /help # View available agents /agents ``` ## üìä View Logs ```bash # View NDP plugin event logs cat ~/.claude/plugins/marketplaces/iowarp-plugins/ndp-plugin/logs/ndp_events.log | jq '.' ``` ## üìñ Documentation ### General - [Marketplace Setup Guide](./MARKETPLACE_SETUP.md) - [Quick Start Guide](./QUICK_START.md) ### NDP Plugin - [NDP Plugin README](./ndp-plugin/README.md) - [Testing Guide](./ndp-plugin/TESTING.md) - [Demo Guide](./ndp-plugin/DEMO_GUIDE.md) - [Hooks Update](./HOOKS_UPDATE_SUMMARY.md) ## üÜò Support For issues or questions: - Check the documentation files - Open an issue on [GitHub](https://github.com/SIslamMun/iowarp-plugin/issues) ## üìÑ License MIT License - See [LICENSE](./ndp-plugin/LICENSE) for details.
files.ndp-plugin/README.md:
# NDP Plugin for Claude Code

A comprehensive Claude Code plugin for the National Data Platform (NDP) that integrates MCP servers, hooks, agents, and custom commands to provide seamless dataset discovery and workflow automation capabilities.

## Features

- **Custom Slash Commands**: Quick access to NDP search, organization listing, and dataset details
- **Specialized Agents**: AI assistants for data science and dataset curation workflows
- **Event Hooks**: Automatic logging of NDP-related activities for observability
- **MCP Integration**: Direct access to NDP API through the iowarp-mcps package

## Installation

### Prerequisites

- Claude Code installed and configured
- Python 3.10 or higher
- `uvx` package manager (for running MCP servers)

### Install the Plugin

#### Option 1: From GitHub (Recommended)

```bash
# Add the marketplace
/plugin marketplace add SIslamMun/iowarp-plugin

# Install the plugin
/plugin install ndp-plugin@iowarp-plugins
```

#### Option 2: Local Development

1. Clone the repository to your local machine
2. Add the plugin directory as a local marketplace:

```bash
# Navigate to the directory containing ndp-plugin
cd /path/to/iowarp-plugin

# In Claude Code, add the local marketplace
/plugin marketplace add /path/to/iowarp-plugin

# Install the plugin
/plugin install ndp-plugin@iowarp-plugins
```

### Verify Installation

After installation, verify the plugin is loaded:

```bash
# List all available commands (should show ndp-* commands)
/help

# List available agents (should show NDP agents)
/agents
```

## Quick Start

### 1. Search for Datasets

Use the `/ndp-search` command to find datasets:

```
/ndp-search

# Then ask:
"Find climate datasets from NOAA"
"Search for oceanographic data in NetCDF format"
```

### 2. List Organizations

Use the `/ndp-organizations` command to explore data sources:

```
/ndp-organizations

# Then ask:
"Show me all organizations with 'climate' in their name"
```

### 3. Get Dataset Details

Use the `/ndp-dataset-details` command to retrieve full metadata:

```
/ndp-dataset-details

# Then provide:
"Get details for dataset with ID 'dataset-12345-climate-temp'"
```

## Components

### Slash Commands

The plugin provides three custom commands:

1. **`/ndp-search`** - Search for datasets across NDP with advanced filtering
2. **`/ndp-organizations`** - List and filter organizations in NDP
3. **`/ndp-dataset-details`** - Get detailed information about specific datasets

### Agents

Two specialized agents are included:

1. **NDP Data Scientist** - Expert in dataset discovery and research workflows
   - Dataset search strategies
   - Data quality assessment
   - Multi-source integration planning

2. **NDP Dataset Curator** - Expert in metadata and publishing workflows
   - Metadata validation
   - CKAN standards compliance
   - Publishing guidance

### Hooks

Event logging hooks track NDP usage:

- **PreToolUse**: Logs before NDP MCP tools are called
- **PostToolUse**: Logs after NDP MCP tools complete
- **SessionStart**: Logs when sessions begin
- **Stop**: Logs session completion

Logs are stored in `${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT}/logs/ndp_events.log`

### MCP Integration

The plugin integrates with **three MCP servers**, providing comprehensive data discovery, analysis, and visualization:

#### NDP MCP (Dataset Discovery)
1. **`list_organizations`** - List organizations from NDP
2. **`search_datasets`** - Search datasets with advanced filtering
3. **`get_dataset_details`** - Retrieve complete dataset metadata

#### Pandas MCP (Data Analysis)
4. **`load_data`** - Load datasets from various formats
5. **`profile_data`** - Comprehensive data profiling
6. **`statistical_summary`** - Detailed statistical analysis

#### Plot MCP (Visualization)
7. **`line_plot`** - Create time-series visualizations
8. **`scatter_plot`** - Show variable relationships
9. **`heatmap_plot`** - Visualize correlation matrices

## Usage Examples

### Example 1: Discover Climate Data

```
User: /ndp-search

Claude: I'll help you search for datasets in the National Data Platform.
What are you looking for?

User: Find climate datasets from NOAA in NetCDF format

Claude: [Uses NDP Data Scientist agent]
[Calls list_organizations to find NOAA]
[Calls search_datasets with organization=NOAA, format=NetCDF]
[Returns results with dataset names, descriptions, and resources]
```

### Example 2: Multi-Server Search

```
User: Search for oceanographic datasets on both global and local servers

Claude: [Uses NDP Data Scientist agent]
[Calls list_organizations on global server]
[Calls list_organizations on local server]
[Calls search_datasets on both servers]
[Compares and presents results from both sources]
```

### Example 3: Dataset Quality Review

```
User: Review the metadata quality for dataset ID "ocean-temp-2023"

Claude: [Uses NDP Dataset Curator agent]
[Calls get_dataset_details for the specified dataset]
[Analyzes metadata completeness]
[Provides recommendations for improvements]
```

## Configuration

### Environment Variables (Optional)

You can configure NDP behavior with environment variables:

```bash
# NDP MCP Configuration
export NDP_DEFAULT_SERVER="global"  # or "local"
export NDP_RESULT_LIMIT="20"        # Maximum results per search

# Logging Configuration
export NDP_LOG_LEVEL="INFO"         # DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR
export NDP_LOG_RETENTION_DAYS="30"  # Auto-cleanup old logs
```

### Viewing Logs

Use the provided script to view event logs:

```bash
./scripts/view-logs.sh
```

Or manually:

```bash
cat logs/ndp_events.log | jq .
```

## Troubleshooting

### Plugin Not Loading

1. Check that the plugin directory structure is correct
2. Verify `plugin.json` is valid JSON
3. Run Claude Code with debug flag: `claude --debug`

### MCP Server Not Available

1. Ensure `uv` is installed: `curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh`
2. Test the MCP server directly: `uvx iowarp-mcps ndp`
3. Check that iowarp-mcps is published to PyPI

### Hooks Not Executing

1. Verify `log_ndp_events.py` is executable: `chmod +x hooks/log_ndp_events.py`
2. Ensure `uv` is installed and available in PATH
3. Review hook configuration in `hooks/hooks.json`

### No Search Results

1. Verify NDP servers are accessible
2. Try different search terms or filters
3. Check server parameter (global vs local)
4. Increase result limit if needed

## Development

### Testing Changes

1. Make changes to plugin files
2. Reinstall the plugin:

```bash
/plugin uninstall ndp-plugin
/plugin install ndp-plugin@local-marketplace
```

3. Restart Claude Code to reload changes

### Adding New Commands

1. Create a new markdown file in `commands/` directory
2. Add YAML frontmatter with description
3. Document the command usage and examples
4. Reload the plugin

### Extending Agents

1. Create new agent markdown files in `agents/` directory
2. Define capabilities in YAML frontmatter
3. Document expertise and use cases
4. Reload the plugin

## Architecture

```
ndp-plugin/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ .claude-plugin/
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ plugin.json          # Plugin metadata and configuration
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ commands/                 # Custom slash commands
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ ndp-search.md
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ ndp-organizations.md
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ ndp-dataset-details.md
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ agents/                   # Specialized AI assistants
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ ndp-data-scientist.md
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ ndp-dataset-curator.md
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ hooks/                    # Event automation
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ hooks.json           # Hook configuration
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ log_ndp_events.py    # Event logging script
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ logs/                     # Event logs (auto-created)
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ ndp_events.log
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ scripts/                  # Utility scripts
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ view-logs.sh         # Log viewer
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ .mcp.json                # MCP server configuration
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ README.md                # This file
```

## Contributing

Contributions are welcome! Please submit issues and pull requests to the [iowarp-plugin repository](https://github.com/SIslamMun/iowarp-plugin).

## License

MIT License - See LICENSE file for details

## Support

- **Documentation**: https://docs.claude.com/en/docs/claude-code/plugins
- **IOWarp MCP Docs**: https://github.com/iowarp/iowarp-mcps
- **Issues**: https://github.com/SIslamMun/iowarp-plugin/issues

## Changelog

### Version 1.0.0 (Initial Release)

- Custom slash commands for NDP search, organizations, and dataset details
- Two specialized agents (Data Scientist and Dataset Curator)
- Event logging hooks for observability
- MCP integration with iowarp-mcps ndp server
- Comprehensive documentation and examples
